Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Human alpha-synuclein (Alpha-Syn, antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; primates, mammals, animals; UCLL1a; BBBh2o)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Active against bacteria E. coli (MIC 0.2 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.2 uM), S. aureus (MIC 0.2 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 0.2 uM), yeast C. albicans (MIC 0.4 uM), C. tropicalis (MIC 0.4 uM), F. neoformans (MIC 0.8 uM), mold A. flavus (MIC 0.8 uM), A. fumigatus (MIC 1.6 uM), A. parasiticus (MIC 1.6 uM), R. solani (MIC 3.2 uM), and T. harzianum (MIC 3.2 uM).
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The PDB link is a micelle-bound structure.You can rotate, zoom, and view the lipid II bound 3D structureherein the PDB.

Literature.Author: Park SC, Moon JC, Shin SY, Son H, Jung YJ, Kim NH, Kim YM, Jang MK, Lee JR.2016
Literature.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2016 Sep 16;478(2):924-8. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2016.08.052.PubMed
Literature.Title: Functional characterization of alpha-synuclein protein with antimicrobial activity

Sequence Information.Comments: AMP Significance: associated with Parkinson's disease. Amyloid AMPs. Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide:  62.61 kcal/mol. SAR: The activity is mainly located at the N-terminal region: 1-60 is active and residues 1-95 are even more active (net charge +3, hydrophobic%, 43%; GRAVY, 0.15; Boman index, 0.56). It is located on bacterial surface and likely targets membranes.
